repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - First State Tax Service (STS)
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First State Tax Service
            (STS) Modernization Project for Ukraine were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the experience in preparing and implementing the project
            offers several lessons that could inform similar project
            designs. Some of these lessons relate to factors that
            impeded project implementation while others reflect factors
            that supported implementation of the project in Ukraine. It
            is impossible to anticipate fundamental changes in the
            operating environment, such as the orange revolution at
            appraisal. It is therefore important to use the flexibility
            offered by a project restructuring to align project design
            to changing realities. It is equally important to reflect
            the impact of restructuring in the formal project
            documentation. The modernization department that implemented
            the project provided about 140 full time staff to support
            the modernization efforts of the STS and by extension
            project implementation. This specific feature of the
            project's implementation arrangements had several
            advantages. First, since the unit is staffed with civil
            servants (as opposed to temporary, external consultants
            hired with project funds) it increased project ownership,
            established important project and change management
            capacities within the Government, improved the transfer of
            inputs developed by project to operational business units
            within the STS while ensuring adequate staff resources were
            dedicated to the modernization effort. Second, since the
            department will be sustained beyond the life of the project
            it not only enhances the sustainability of project
            achievements, but also enables the STS to expand and deepen
            its reform efforts and provide strong coordination among all
            modernization activities independent of the source of financing.
